cleaned_text: Balance Quotes (61) Spiritual Sayings Summary: Definition of Balance. An even distribution of weight enabling someone or something to remain upright and steady. A condition in which different elements are equal or in the correct proportions. The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty. ~ Zig Ziglar Balance, peace, and joy are the fruit of a successful life. It starts with recognizing your talents and finding ways to serve others by using them. ~ Thomas Kinkade "Mathematics expresses values that reflect the cosmos, including orderliness, balance, harmony, logic, and abstract beauty." ~ Deepak Chopra "The ingredients of both darkness and light are equally present in all of us,...The madness of this planet is largely a result of the human being's difficulty in coming to viruous balance with himself. " ~ Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving. ~ Albert Einstein I believe that being successful means having a balance of success stories across the many areas of your life. You can't truly be considered successful in your business life if your home life is in shambles. ~ Zig Ziglar I want to keep audiences off balance, so they don't know who I am or how to take me. If I duck and weave, as Frank Bruno might say, I'll have a longer shelf life. ~ Robert Carlyle Man maintains his balance, poise, and sense of security only as he is moving forward. ~ Maxwell Maltz I've learned to keep things simple. Look at your choices, pick the best one, then go to work with all your heart. ~ Pat Riley There is not secret to balance. You just have to feel the waves. ~ Frank Herbert Action is at bottom a swinging and flailing of the arms to regain one's balance and keep afloat. ~ Eric Hoffer Women need real moments of solitude and self reflection to balance out how much of ourselves we give away. ~ Barbara De Angelis No one can make you feel inferior without your consent. ~ Eleanor Roosevelt Balance is the perfect state of still water. Let that be our model. It remains quiet within and is not disturbed on the surface. ~ Confucius To live in a harmonious balance of commitments and pleasures is what I strive for. ~ Jane Rule Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance, order, rhythm and harmony. ~ Thomas Merton Be aware of wonder. Live a balanced life - learn some and think some and draw and paint and sing and dance and play and work every day some. ~ Robert Fulghum It's all about quality of life and finding a happy balance between work and friends and family. ~ Philip Green Toleration is the greatest gift of the mind; it requires the same effort of the brain that it takes to balance oneself on a bicycle. ~ Helen Keller Prosperity is no just scale; adversity is the only balance to weigh friends. ~ Plutarch Almost every wise saying has an opposite one, no less wise, to balance it. ~ George Santayana The sanity of society is a balance of a thousand insanity's. ~ Ralph Waldo Emerson Problems arise in that one has to find a balance between what people need from you and what you need for yourself. ~ Jessye Norman Balance, peace, and joy are the fruit of a successful life. ~ Thomas Kinkade Life is a balance between rest and movement. ~ Rajneesh Find your balance and stand with it. Find your song and sing it out. Find your cadence and let it appear like a dance. Find the questions that only you know how to ask and The answers that you are content to not know. ~ Mary Anne Radmacher Manage the remarkable balance between acting from your heart and close to your gifts with completing the obligations that your labor and tasks require of you. Leverage opportunity AND seize joy. ~ Mary Anne Radmacher Balance happens when I invite it to happen with my intentional actions and my guided perspective. ~ Mary Anne Radmacher We are led by lawyers who do not understand either technology or balance sheets. ~ Thomas Friedman A warrior balances solitude and dependence. ~ Paulo Coelho The best and safest thing is to keep a balance in your life, acknowledge the great powers around us and in us. If you can do that, and live that way, you are really a wise man. ~ Euripides Just as your car runs more smoothly and requires less energy to go faster and farther when the wheels are in perfect alignment, you perform better when your thoughts, feelings, emotions, goals, and values are in balance. ~ Brian Tracy All audiences should be slightly off balance. ~ Richard Thompson Bodies which contain a greater proportion of water than is necessary to balance the other elements, are speedily corrupted, and lose their virtues and properties. ~ Marcus Vitruvius Pollio Next to love, balance is the most important thing. ~ John Wooden If the blood humor is too strong and robust, calm it with balance and harmony. ~ Xunzi The final mystery is oneself. When one has weighed the sun in the balance, and measured the steps of the moon, and mapped out the seven heavens star by star, there still remains oneself. Who can calculate the orbit of his own soul? ~ Oscar Wilde People with great gifts are easy to find, but symmetrical and balanced ones never. ~ Ralph Waldo Emerson You will never 'find' time for anything. If you want time, you must make it. ~ Charles Buxton There is no such thing as work-life balance. Everything worth fighting for unbalances your life. ~ Alain de Botton Evermore in the world is this marvelous balance of beauty and disgust, magnificence and rats. ~ Ralph Waldo Emerson I very much prefer the balance in a scene to standing out and so you have to make a decision ~ William Hurt Wisdom is your perspective on life, your sense of balance, your understanding of how the various parts and principles apply and relate to each other. ~ Stephen Covey There are men who can write poetry, and there are men who can read balance sheets. The men who can read balance sheets cannot write. ~ Henry R. Luce I try to keep a balance between conceptional or intellectual comprehension and emotional understanding. ~ Noto I want my life to effect the balance to the positive. ~ Mira Sorvino I believe in trying to get a balance between individual freedom on the one hand and social responsibility on the other. ~ Chris Patten You can't have too much of everything, you must have a balance, that's very important. ~ Abdullah Ahmad Badawi I balanced all, brought all to mind, the years to come seemed waste of breath, a waste of breath the years behind, in balance with this life, this death. ~ William Butler Yeats The words are ludicrous at times, but you add the reality to it and that gives it the balance it has ~ Alia Shawkat I think what I'm going to do is get more balance in my life to still be able to go out and play the hard rock 'n' roll and do what I like to do in music ~ Joan Jett A good balance of winning and losing is important. If you just win all the time, you won't get anything out of it; having some tough losses can be really important. ~ Andrew Shue I learned again that the mind-body-spirit connection has to be in balance. ~ Wynonna Judd I have the feeling that in a balanced life one should die penniless. The trick is dismantling. ~ Art Garfunkel The chief concern of the French Impressionists was the discovery of balance between light and dark. ~ Stephen Gardiner Advice is seldom welcome, and those who need it the most, like it the least. ~ Lord Chesterfield The human mind, if it is to keep its sanity, must maintain the nicest balance between unity and plurality. ~ Irving Babbitt When a man asks himself what is meant by action he proves that he isn't a man of action. Action is a lack of balance. In order to act you must be somewhat insane. A reasonably sensible man is satisfied with thinking. ~ James A.
